subject: Re: Help,what's wrong with my TDD practice in my daily life?
msgSnippet: ... any ... write so ... a is ... make ... then ... Yes ,you got my idea .Do you mean that I should stop at forth step refactor because of need not refactor
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Ilja Preuss <it@...> wrote:
>
> hyysguyang wrote:
> > In my opinion about the requirement,I think I should not reverse
any
> > other sentence but
> > the 'TDD is a software devolopment technology',so I needn't
write so
> > many test but the test below
> >
> > @Test public void testReverse(){
> > StringReverser sr=new StringReverser();
> > String str = "Tdd is a software devolopment
> > technology";
> > Assert.assertEquals("technology devolopment software
a is
> > Tdd",sr.reverse(str));
> > }
> > after this I refactor to the final code described befoe.Maybe I
make
> > a large jump.
>
> If this is the only requirement, your final code was more complex
then
> needed. A hardcoded return value already would have fulfilled that
> requirement.
>
> Cheers, Ilja
>

Yes ,you got my idea .Do you mean that I should stop at forth step
refactor because of need not refactor indeed?In fact I confused just
here?I don't known should to refactor.

I think what you say is as below:

public Object reverse(String str) {
return "technology devolopment software a is Tdd";
}

But in my opinion ,I think that string 'Tdd is a software ...' in
test is duplicated with before string in some ways ,then I refactor
and generate the final complex code .May be I made a mistakes on
here,do you think so£¿

Thanks.
